1394772091660951555 [2021-05-18] @visakanv 💜 3333 🔁 559 💬 45 [(SEED) type=root]
the stuff you joke about (even ironically or whatever) has a way of shaping your reality so be careful and deliberate with that stuff. a lot of people out here fumbling their own bags by joking about outcomes they don’t want. you might as well joke about the outcomes you do want

│   │   you’re very unlikely to get what you don’t ask for if it’s significant
│   │   
│   │   if you ask for something totally “impractical/unrealistic”, it’ll likely require a bunch of additional work — you’ll have to stay with the ask consistently for months, years, and answer the followup questions
│   │   ↓

│   │   so if it’s like, “I wanna be rich, it’ll be so funny if I were rich haha” – you can’t just say it once. it’s not THAT simple. you have to keep thinking it. then you’ll start to notice silly opportunities and silly business ideas more than you used to, and it compounds from there

│       Images:
│         - [Image #0] The image shows a page from a book titled "CONSCIOUS COMPLAINING" on page 146. The text discusses the importance of maintaining a balance between focus and relaxation, and how ignoring or repressing emotions can lead to negative consequences.
│           
│           Here is the full text:
│           
│           **CONSCIOUS COMPLAINING**
│           
│           Focus, grounding, and definition are states to aspire to, but no one can maintain them at all times. The brain doesn't appreciate constant focus, and life is a drag if all you do is work. Resting, daydreaming, fooling around, laughing, napping, and playing are extremely important in a whole and happy life. Learning to flow means learning to relax; it's important to keep things light. However, if you can't ground, focus, or define yourself when you want to, that's a horse of a different color.
│           
│           It is easy to get into troubling moods or stagnant places and forget all your skills and all your emotional wisdom; it's easy to fall into emotional repression and incompetent expression. When this happens (and it will), your ignored and mismanaged emotions will intensify and repeat themselves—because neither repression nor improper expression can ever address the issues your emotions are trying to bring forward. If you continue to ignore your emotions (and you will), they'll become louder and more aggressive. Soon, they'll arise in response to totally unrelated situations. Cycling depressions and rages, anxiety attacks, and obsessive worry are all examples of emotions that have become trapped in a bothersome feedback loop. What started out as mobile emotions become monotonous, tormenting, and chronic responses to the world.
│           
│           When your emotions are welcomed and honored, they move easily and quickly—they arise in response to real situations, they contribute precisely what you need, and then they retreat cheerfully. In contrast, a disruption

rating.reasoning_summary: This strand centers on Visakanv's viral 2021 insight: 'joke about the outcomes you want.' The boundary object is the concept that speech acts—especially jokes—have causal power over reality, functioning as intention-setting or manifestation. The arc spans 2020-2025, beginning with a throwaway joke about Mark Zuckerberg doing MMA, crystallizing into the core thesis in May 2021, then evolving through 50+ numbered examples where jokes-become-reality (Trump's presidency, Omicron as 'natural vaccine,' meeting partners at Vibecamp). The discourse is *constructive*—people adopt the frame as a practical heuristic, applying it to career moves, relationships, and community-building. By 2024, it's become embedded TPOT vocabulary ('joke about outcomes you want' is shorthand). High cohesion (same core group riffing for years), medium-high evolution (from observation to praxis to meta-commentary), and high utility (actionable life advice with receipts).

essential_tweets.annotation: Pre-history: The Zuck MMA joke (2020)—earliest example of Visa joking about an outcome, setting the template
The Catalyst: 'joke about outcomes you want' thesis statement (May 2021)—becomes the boundary object
Personal proof-of-concept: Visa stopped joking about being broke, started making money
Dialectic: Qiaochu introduces bidirectional causality—are you manifesting or presciently sensing the future?
Application: Qiaochu jokes about meeting his wife at the airport in a P100 mask (becomes running meme)
Synthesis: 'You can't make fun of a thing without it seeping into you'—extends the frame beyond aspiration to critique
The Trump Receipt: Screenshot showing Trump was taunted into running for president via joke (validates thesis)
The Steak Experiment: XKCD jokingly asks for hypersonic wind tunnel data, researchers deliver—pure meme→reality
Historical Deep Dive: Confessio Fraternitatis as 1615 example of 'joke about outcomes you want' at societal scale
Long Arc Payoff: Ultimape jokes about gorilla diet for years, finally buys primate food and goes 'GorillaMaxxing' (2024)
